question_text: A 50-year-old woman is evaluated for dysphagia. Images from left to right show the appearance of the esophagus 1 minute, 3 minutes, and 5 minutes after ingestion of barium.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is achalasia (Option A), a hypertonic motility condition defined by inadequate relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter. Barium esophagram shows dilation of the esophagus with narrowing at the gastroesophageal junction, known as a “bird's beak,” and absence of peristalsis. Achalasia can be idiopathic or associated with autoimmune conditions, neurodegenerative disorders, and infection (Chagas disease).
